results.title: John Brown, Rose and the midnight cat
results.brief_description: Illustrations by Ron Brooks from the book of the same name by Australian writer Jenny Wagner are used to tell the story of Rose, an old widow, and John Brown, her trusty sheep dog, who live together comfortably until a midnight cat strays into their garden and challenges John Brown for Rose’s affections. Adaptation by Ernest Troost. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: John Barrymore
results.creator_credit: David L. Wolper and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biography”.
Portrays events in the life of film and theatre idol John Barrymore, using photographs and film footage. An excellent, insightful and refreshingly unsentimental biography. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: John Arden: playwright
results.creator_credit: David Naden, Mithras Films, David Naden and Associates and John irvin
results.brief_description: A study of the modern British playwright, John Arden, by a group of young filmmakers. They have attempted “to make the business of being a playwright seem less remote, more immediate and understandable”. reveals the effect of his wife’s criticism upon his writing. Filmed at his home in Yorkshire.

results.title: John
results.creator_credit: James Robertson, Joyce Robertson and Tavistock Institute of Human Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young Children in Brief Separation”.
A nine day record of the changes in the behaviour of a 17 months old boy in a residential nursery. Interesting observation of a young child experiencing pain of separation from loving parents. Commentary by Joyce Robertson.

results.title: Johanna
results.creator_credit: J. Adisubrata, Gramedia Film and Wim Umboh
results.brief_description: A young Lydia Kandou plays Johanna, a Dutchman’s daughter living during the Dutch occupation of Indonesia. Johanna is kidnapped by Pengkuh, a local rebel whose girlfriend is killed by a Dutch soldier, and taken to the jungle. What develops between the Dutch girl and Pengkuh is a ‘Blue Lagoon’ type inter-racial romance set against the lush, green backdrop of the Javanese forest. The film features rare explicit on-screen kisses, which would otherwise only be seen in the genre of cheap ‘sex-themed’ Indonesian films. Cast includes Lydia Kandou and Atek Sudharmo. In Indonesian with English subtitles.

results.title: Joh's jury
results.creator_credit: Rod Allan, ABC-TV (Australia), Southern Star Sullivan Productions and Ken Cameron
results.brief_description: From the team who created the award-winning ‘Police State’ and ‘Police Crop’ comes the gripping story of the jury deliberations which followed the 1991 trial of former Queensland Premier, Sir Joh Bjelke-Petersen. On trial for perjury, Sir Joh, the man responsible for shaping the cultural ethos of Australia’s ‘Deep North’, would now be judged by his peers. Based on extensive research, ‘Joh’s Jury’ is about twelve ordinary people struggling to come to a unamimous decision on a case which was bound to end in controversy. It is a dramatic interpretation of real events using Court transcripts and interviews with key participants in the trial of Sir Joh Bjelke-Petersen, including members of the jury. Stars Gerry Connolly as Sir Joh Bjelke-Petersen, Penny Cook, Noah Taylor, John Jarratt Norman Yemm and John Clayton.

results.title: Jogging for physical fitness
results.creator_credit: Film Services and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Explains why jogging is beneficial to health and details a basic jogging program as a means of keeping fit. Companion film to “Walking for physical fitness” (507829).

results.title: Joey: the autobiography of Joey Deacon (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Goodchild, Brian Gibson and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Joey Deacon, born in 1920 with brain damage, grew up severely spastic, unable to talk or walk. When, in 1928, his mother died, he was sent to an institution where he lived for years, quite unable to make himself understood. Then, in 1941, he met Ernie Roberts who had one remarkable skill - he could understand Joey. This led to a new and richer life, and this film tells Joey’s remarkable story. Based on Joey Deacon’s book “Tongue tied”.

results.title: Joey runs away (K)
results.creator_credit: Paul R. Gagne, Weston Woods Studios and Daniel Ivanick
results.brief_description: Joey, a young kangaroo, tired of his mother’s complaints about his messy room in her pouch, decides to run away. While Joey searches for a new home, word gets around that his mother has an empty room. What follows will entertain children of all ages. Based on the book by Jack Kent.

results.title: Joey
results.creator_credit: Michael Lake, Village Roadshow Pictures and Ian Barry
results.brief_description: Kangaroos hold a special place in Billy’s (Jamie Croft) heart, he even trespasses to protect them from being hunted on neighbouring Queensland farms. His evil neighbour, Dixon (Errol O’Neill) hires a Kanga Catcher who drugs the kangaroos and transports them to the city, all but a lonely joey who Billy rescues. Together with the daughter of an American ambassador, boy, girl and joey begin a journey to reunite the young kangaroo with its kidnapped family. An adventure film that the whole family will enjoy. Cast also includes Alex McKenna, Rebecca Gibney, Ed Begley Jr and Ruth Cracknell.
